column1: Independence was declared on the fourth of July in 1776
George Washington was the first President of the United States
The Constitution of the United States was written in 1787
The Civil War was fought from 1861 to 1865
The Battle of Saratoga was the turning point of the American Revolution
The Battle of Gettysburg was the turning point in the Civil War for the North
James Madison is considered to be the Father of the Constitution
Jefferson Davis was the President of the Confederacy during the Civil War
The Thirteenth Amendment abolished slavery in the United States
The Constitutional Convention was held in the city of Philadelphia
